bug.author: arraydude
bug.summary: height parameter is not working for pydeck_chart()
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
There is no way to set the height or width for a pydeck chart, neither with a height parameter or using Deck object <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
We should able to set it with pdk.ViewState() <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
The component is resetting initialViewState height and width from the props but pydeck_chart() has no height or width parameter

comments.comment: Looks to be fixed in latest version (0.60.0) We can set the height via pdk.ViewState() as well as via props to pydeck_chart, but height prop isn't exposed to the user, it's used by FullScreenWrapper and WideMode. <denchmark-code>st.pydeck_chart( pdk.Deck( initial_view_state=pdk.ViewState( latitude=37.76, longitude=-122.4, zoom=11, pitch=50, height=500, width=500 ), layers=[ pdk.Layer( </denchmark-code>
